Package chess

Class Chess

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chess

  • public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
    Chess game and methods. Contains code for en passant, promotion, castling (regular and queen side), check, checkmate and stalemate.
    Author:
    alh220, jmuccino
    See Also:
    ChessBoard, Piece

    • Method Detail

      • removeEnpassant

        private static void removeEnpassant​()
        Remove GhostPawn belonging to current player from board. This method is run at the start of each turn, so if White, for example, moved a pawn two spaces on their last turn, we are removing the GhostPawn from the board because the chance for En Passant is over.

      • checkMoves

        private static boolean checkMoves​(java.lang.String[] moves)

        Preliminary validation of user input. Checks for number of parameters and determines validity based on those parameters.

        In addition to validating user input format, also checks for resignation, draw requests, draw confirmation, and promotion requests.

        Parameters:
        moves - a String array containing all parameters of user input.
        Returns:
        a boolean determining whether or not what the user entered was a valid command.

      • illegalMove

        private static void illegalMove​()
        Method to print when move is illegal.

      • getArrayVals

        private static int[] getArrayVals​(java.lang.String move)
        Takes input of board position (i.e. a1 or e5) and returns array indices that reference positions on board.
        Parameters:
        move - String representing a board position passed in through user input.
        Returns:
        integer array representing the row and column indices on the board on success. Positions include -1 on error.

      • validMoveForPiece

        private static boolean validMoveForPiece​(Piece piece,
                                         int startRow,
                                         int endRow,
                                         int startCol,
                                         int endCol)

        This method continues checking validity of move. First, it C]checks to make sure that the piece exists and is the correct color.

        If promotion is flagged, it makes sure that this piece is a pawn and is moving to the correct (final) rank for the color.

        Next it checks whether this move is valid by calling Piece.isLegalMove(int, int, int, int, chess.ChessBoard) and Piece.coastClear(int, int, int, int, chess.ChessBoard)

        Finally, it checks to make sure that if the square the piece is trying to move to contains another piece, that it is of the opposite color.

        Parameters:
        piece - A chess piece inherited from the Piece object
        startRow - An integer between 0-7 signifying which rank the piece exists on.
        endRow - An integer between 0-7 signifying which rank the player is moving the piece to.
        startCol - An integer between 0-7 signifying which file the piece exists on.
        endCol - An integer between 0-7 signifying which file the player is moving the piece to.
        Returns:
        a boolean signifying whether or not the move is valid. Could return false if the player is selecting a square on the board that does not contain their piece or is moving the piece in an illegal way,

      • checkForPromotion

        private static Piece checkForPromotion​(Piece piece,
                                       int row,
                                       java.lang.String[] moves)
        Method checks for promotion and sets up promotion if not requested when pawn moves to last row. Calls promote.
        Parameters:
        piece - A chess piece inherited from the Piece object
        row - An integer between 0-7 representing the starting row of a move.
        moves - an integer array holding the user input
        Returns:
        a Piece object that pawn was promoted to.

      • promote

        private static Piece promote​(java.lang.String strPiece)
        Called from checkForPromotion(chess.Piece, int, java.lang.String[]). Takes in a string of what to promote to and returns that new piece.
        Parameters:
        strPiece - string reperesentation of piece requested.
        Returns:
        Piece object requested.

      • checkForCastle

        private static int checkForCastle​(Piece piece,
                                  int startRow,
                                  int endRow,
                                  int startCol,
                                  int endCol)
        If the King is requesting a castle, checks to see if it can. First it checks to make sure it is not currently in Check. Next we make a copy of the board and move the piece over one square and verify that the King is not check (because the King cannot move through check). If he is in check, we revert the board and return a -1. Otherwise, we perform the castle by calling performCastle(chess.Piece, int, int, int, int) method and we return 0 to signal that we successfully castled.
        Parameters:
        piece - A chess piece inherited from the Piece object
        startRow - An integer between 0-7 signifying which rank the piece exists on.
        endRow - An integer between 0-7 signifying which rank the player is moving the piece to.
        startCol - An integer between 0-7 signifying which file the piece exists on.
        endCol - An integer between 0-7 signifying which file the player is moving the piece to.
        Returns:
        an integer: 0 for success, -1 for error, and 1 for "Not King" (which is not an error)

      • performCastle

        private static void performCastle​(Piece piece,
                                  int startRow,
                                  int endRow,
                                  int startCol,
                                  int endCol)
        Performs the actual Castle. Checks for Queenside vs Kingside castling, then moves the pieces around.
        Parameters:
        piece - A chess piece inherited from the Piece object
        startRow - An integer between 0-7 signifying which rank the piece exists on.
        endRow - An integer between 0-7 signifying which rank the player is moving the piece to.
        startCol - An integer between 0-7 signifying which file the piece exists on.
        endCol - An integer between 0-7 signifying which file the player is moving the piece to.

      • enforceEnpassant

        private static void enforceEnpassant​(int endCol)
        Method to enforce en passant. Called when a ghost pawn is killed by a pawn of the opposite color. This method just sets the pawn's square to null.
        Parameters:
        endCol - an integer representing the column that the piece was in.

      • whiteCheck

        private static boolean whiteCheck​(ChessBoard board)

        Checks for white in Check by going through the entire board and checking to see if any black piece can reach the King.

        Uses Piece.isLegalMove(int, int, int, int, chess.ChessBoard) and Piece.coastClear(int, int, int, int, chess.ChessBoard) to validate moves.

        Parameters:
        board - A ChessBoard object of the board that we are looking for check on.
        Returns:
        a boolean telling whether or not white is in check.

      • blackCheck

        private static boolean blackCheck​(ChessBoard board)

        Checks for black in Check by going through the entire board and checking to see if any white piece can reach the King.

        Uses Piece.isLegalMove(int, int, int, int, chess.ChessBoard) and Piece.coastClear(int, int, int, int, chess.ChessBoard) to validate moves.

        Parameters:
        board - A ChessBoard object of the board that we are looking for check on.
        Returns:
        a boolean telling whether or not black is in check.

      • checkForMate

        private static boolean checkForMate​()
        Checks for Checkmate/StaleMate. This method goes through the entire board, grabs every piece of the opposite color, and moves it to every place returned from Piece.allLegalMoves(int, int, chess.ChessBoard) on a new temporary board. It then calls whiteCheck(chess.ChessBoard) or blackCheck(chess.ChessBoard) depending on the turn. If it returns false, then there exists a move where the player will not be in check, so we return false for checkmate/stalemate.
        Returns:
        boolean telling whether or not checkmate or stalemate currently exists.

      • changeTurns

        private static void changeTurns​()
        Change value of turn variable between "White" and "Black". This changes who's turn it is in the game.

      • playGame

        private static void playGame​(java.util.Scanner scanner)
        The actual game. A loop that continues until game over.
        Parameters:
        scanner - the stream that the players type their commands into.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method that starts the game up.
        Parameters:
        args - should be empty. We are not checking for command line arguments, so if any are entered they will be ignored.
